missed.title: Cross-Site Scripting via Image Source Attribute
missed.reason: The /xss2 endpoint containing this XSS vulnerability was not successfully exploited. Actual findings show the endpoint is broken and returns HTTP 500 Internal Server Error for all requests. The testers documented the endpoint exists but is non-functional, preventing exploitation of the expected XSS vulnerability related to image URL sanitization bypass. The vulnerability may still exist in the code, but it could not be demonstrated through the broken endpoint.

extra.title: Aggressive Browser Caching on Static Assets with Public Cache-Control
extra.assessment: New discovery - Configuration vulnerability not in expected findings. Cache-Control headers on static assets (/static/) allow 12-hour browser caching with public directive, potentially exposing stale data and delaying security updates.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers - No Content-Security-Policy
extra.assessment: New discovery - Security misconfiguration not in expected findings. Application missing critical security headers (CSP, X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection) that could help prevent XSS and other attacks.

extra.title: Service Unavailability - XSS2 Endpoint Returns Persistent 500 Internal Server Error
extra.assessment: New discovery - Availability/reliability issue not in expected findings. The /xss2 endpoint consistently returns HTTP 500 errors for all GET requests, making it inaccessible. This prevents both legitimate use and exploitation of intended functionality.

extra.title: Server Information Disclosure - Werkzeug and Python Version Exposed
extra.assessment: New discovery - Information disclosure vulnerability not in expected findings. Server header exposes Werkzeug/1.0.1 and Python/2.7.18 versions, enabling attackers to research version-specific CVEs. Python 2.7 is end-of-life with no security updates.

extra.title: Malformed HTML Structure - Missing DOCTYPE and Closing Tags
extra.assessment: New discovery - Code quality/standards issue not in expected findings. HTML document lacks proper DOCTYPE declaration and has unclosed tags, violating HTML5 standards and potentially causing rendering issues.

extra.title: Improper Error Handling - Missing Error Context and Diagnostics
extra.assessment: New discovery - Error handling deficiency not in expected findings. /xss2 endpoint returns generic 500 errors without error tracking identifiers (X-Error-ID, X-Request-ID), making diagnosis and debugging impossible.

extra.title: Path Traversal and Routing Bypass - Multiple Representations Access Same Vulnerable Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - Routing/path normalization vulnerability not in expected findings. Multiple path variations (/xss2, /%2fxss2, //xss2, /./xss2, etc.) all normalize to the /xss2 endpoint, potentially bypassing path-based security controls and WAF rules.
